intro: Thelycrania candidissima, commonly known as the white sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Thelycrania candidissima is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can tolerate periods of drought. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh environment.
